sentence.Network_en: Her sudden departure has disarranged my plans.
sentence.Network_cn: 她突然离去,打乱了我的计划.

sentence.Network_en: My son disarranged the papers on my desk.
sentence.Network_cn: 我的儿子打乱了在我桌上的纸张.

sentence.Network_en: He whistled softly, surveying the mess of disarranged furniture.
sentence.Network_cn: 他轻轻地吹着口哨, 眼睛环视着凌乱不堪的家具.

list.abs: Anxiety may disarrange the stomach ., 焦急忧虑可以引起胃.
relation between chronic renal insufficiency and lipoprotein disarrangement慢性肾功能不全与血脂紊乱的关系
disarrange or rumple ; dishevel ., 打乱或弄乱 ; 使蓬乱.
disarrange sb ' s papers , hair ., 弄乱某人的文件 , 头发.

means.word_mean: 1. having the arrangement disturbed; not in order;

auth_sentence.content: He said Le had broken bones and that her underwear had been disarranged.
auth_sentence.res_content: He said Le had broken bones and that her underwear had been disarranged.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He said Le had broken bones and that her underwear had been disarranged.

auth_sentence.content: In a frenzy they disarranged their hair, tore their garments and rushed screaming out of the city.
auth_sentence.res_content: In a frenzy they disarranged their hair, tore their garments and rushed screaming out of the city.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In a frenzy they disarranged their hair, tore their garments and rushed screaming out of the city.
